metadata.title: Beijing Business Mandarin
metadata.description: Learning Mandarin for a successful business trip to Beijing.

curriculum.lesson_topic: Beijing Business Mandarin: Learning Mandarin for a successful business trip to Beijing

sub_topics.sub_topic: Greetings and Introductions in a Business Setting
sub_topics.description: Learners will master polite greetings and formal self-introductions suitable for initial business meetings in Beijing.
Learners will be able to ask for and understand directions, use public transportation, and navigate to common business locations in Beijing.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Ordering Food and Drinks at Business Lunches
sub_topics.description: Learners will be able to confidently order food and beverages at business lunches, understand basic restaurant etiquette, and make small talk related to the meal.
Learners will learn vocabulary related to meeting agendas and objectives, enabling them to participate in basic discussions about meeting goals.
Learners will be able to express their opinions politely, agree or disagree respectfully, and ask for clarification during business discussions.

flashcards.example: 你好，欢迎来到北京！(Nǐ hǎo, huānyíng lái dào Běijīng!) - Hello, welcome to Beijing!
谢谢您的帮助。(Xièxiè nín de bāngzhù.) - Thank you for your help.
不用谢，不客气。(Búyòng xiè, bú kèqì.) - You're welcome, don't mention it.
请进，请坐。(Qǐng jìn, qǐng zuò.) - Please come in, please sit.
对不起，我迟到了。(Duìbùqǐ, wǒ chídào le.) - Sorry, I'm late.
没关系，下次注意。(Méi guānxi, xià cì zhùyì.) - It's okay, pay attention next time.
是的，我是经理。(Shì de, wǒ shì jīnglǐ.) - Yes, I am the manager.
我不是北京人。(Wǒ bú shì Běijīng rén.) - I am not from Beijing.
请问，多少钱？(Qǐngwèn, duōshao qián?) - Excuse me, how much does it cost?
明天见，再见！(Míngtiān jiàn, zàijiàn!) - See you tomorrow, goodbye!

exercises.sentence: 在北京的商务会议上，互相___名片是很重要的礼仪。
exercises.explanation: "交换 (jiāo huàn)" means to exchange, which is the correct action for business cards in a meeting. "赠送 (zèng sòng)" means to give as a gift, "展示 (zhǎn shì)" means to display, and "购买 (gòu mǎi)" means to buy; none fit the context of exchanging business cards.

exercises.sentence: 如果您需要帮助，可以随时___我的手机给我打电话。
exercises.explanation: "用 (yòng)" means to use, indicating using the phone to call. "是 (shì)" means is, "有 (yǒu)" means have, and "在 (zài)" means at/in/on, which do not fit the context of making a phone call.

exercises.sentence: 为了准时到达会议，我需要提前___出租车。
exercises.explanation: "预订 (yù dìng)" means to book in advance, which is necessary for ensuring a taxi is available. "驾驶 (jià shǐ)" means to drive, "取消 (qǔ xiāo)" means to cancel, and "退还 (tuì huán)" means to return; none are relevant to arranging transportation.

exercises.sentence: 这家餐厅的北京烤鸭非常有名，我建议您___一下。
exercises.explanation: "尝 (cháng)" means to taste, which is appropriate when recommending a dish. "看 (kàn)" means to see, "买 (mǎi)" means to buy, and "做 (zuò)" means to make; none are suitable for suggesting someone try a dish.

exercises.sentence: 在谈判之前，了解对方公司的文化___很重要。
exercises.explanation: "背景 (bèi jǐng)" means background, referring to cultural background. "语言 (yǔ yán)" means language, "产品 (chǎn pǐn)" means product, and "价格 (jià gé)" means price; only understanding the cultural background fits the context of pre-negotiation preparation.

simulation.title: A Smooth Arrival: Landing a Deal in Beijing
simulation.setting: Zhang Wei, a young American businessman, is on his first trip to Beijing to finalize a deal with a Chinese company. He's been studying Mandarin, hoping to make a good impression and facilitate better communication during his visit. This scene captures his arrival and initial interactions at the airport.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.target_language_text: 张伟抵达北京首都国际机场。
content.phonetics: Zhāng Wěi dǐdá Běijīng shǒudū guójì jīchǎng.
content.base_language_translation: Zhang Wei arrives at Beijing Capital International Airport.

content.speaker: Immigration Officer
content.phonetics: Nǐ hǎo. Qǐng gěi wǒ nǐ de hùzhào.
content.base_language_translation: Hello. Please give me your passport.

content.speaker: Immigration Officer
content.phonetics: Xièxiè. Nǐ lái Běijīng zuò shénme?
content.base_language_translation: Thank you. What are you here to do in Beijing?

content.speaker: Immigration Officer
content.phonetics: Hǎo de. Zhù nǐ lǚtú yúkuài!

content.speaker: Narrator
content.target_language_text: 张伟顺利通过了海关，去取他的行李。
content.phonetics: Zhāng Wěi shùnlì tōngguò le hǎiguān, qù qǔ tā de xínglǐ.
content.base_language_translation: Zhang Wei smoothly passes through customs and goes to pick up his luggage.
